content: 2 inches from the outer edge wrap & turn i used german short row knit back to the inner edge knit to approx 2 inches from the previous wrap & turn wrap & turn knit back to the inner edge decrease at the inner edge again then knit all the way to the outer edge working wraps together if needed depending on technique used triple-stranding as you knit step 1 tie end of working yarn step 2 reach through loop and step 3 hold knot with into a loop with a knot pull through working one hand and pull yarn yarn through with other step 4 keep pulling for awhile step 5 after working through that to create a length of tripled yarn tripled yarn when the end loop step 5 continued is reached pull working yarn through again to make more freefree by lee meredith leedoesstuff com page 8 weaving in ends as you knit throwers step 1 after knitting fi rst/edge st step 2 wrap working yarn around step 3 pull yarn through st to knit normally with needle through next needle as if to knit normally normally also pulling it down st to knit it run under the end strand of yarn end yarn up over top of right- hand needle step 4 complete the knit st the step 5 knit the next st normally step 6 end yarn is now locked end yarn will now run up over the while holding the end yarn strand down repeat steps 1 5 for several working yarn down so working yarn traps it more sts weaving in ends as you knit pickers step 1 after knitting fi rst/edge st step 2 wrap working yarn around step 3 unwrap end yarn now normally with needle through next needle as if to knit normally so moving it back to the left then st to knit it run end yarn held in now both yarns are wrapped behind needle and over to the right hand down under right-hand around the same way right needle and around over the front same as if to knit step 4 with end yarn now held off to the right side step 5 work the next st normally holding end knit the st normally with the working yarn so that yarn off to the right then repeat steps 1 5 for end yarn is held several more sts down under working yarn/st ffrreeeeffrreeee by lee meredith leedoesstuff com page 9
